images.caption: “New Pit” where kaolinite mining came to an end in 1991. The layer of kaolinite is visible above the water level, the higher level of the overlying kaolinite consists of glacifluvial sands.
The layer of kaolinite flooded with water, additional kaolinite is visible to the left of the water area in the picture; “New Pit”.
Fire brick factory processing kaolinite extracted in the open mines at Vidnava
Pellet of amber approximately 2 cm found in the “New Pit”
